instructions: Image titled Enable JavaScript Step 1 1 Open Chrome. It's a red, green, yellow, and blue spherical icon. Image titled Enable JavaScript Step 2 2 Tap . This icon is in the top-right corner of the screen. Image titled Enable JavaScript Step 3 3 Tap . It's near the bottom of the drop-down menu. Image titled Enable JavaScript Step 4 4 Scroll down and tap . It's about halfway down the page. Image titled Enable JavaScript Step 5 5 Tap . This option is near the middle of the Site Settings page. Image titled Enable JavaScript Step 6 6 Tap the grey switch. It will slide right and turn blue or green Image titled Android7systemswitchon2.png . Doing so enables JavaScript on your Android's Chrome browser. Note: If the JavaScript switch is blue or green, JavaScript is already enabled. Advertisement

Image titled Enable JavaScript Step 15 1 Open your iPhone's Settings Image titled Iphonesettingsappicon.png . It's a grey group of gears on the Home Screen. Image titled Enable JavaScript Step 16 2 Scroll down and tap . This option is roughly halfway down the Settings page. There's a blue Safari icon on the left side of this option. Image titled Enable JavaScript Step 17 3 Scroll all the way down and tap . It's at the bottom of the screen. Image titled Enable JavaScript Step 18 4 Slide the white JavaScript Image titled Iphoneswitchofficon.png switch right. It will turn green Image titled Iphoneswitchonicon1.png . Doing so enables JavaScript on your iPhone's Safari browser. Tip: You may need to close and re-open Safari in order for JavaScript to start working. Advertisement
